intro: Ophrys incubacea var. fucifera, commonly known as the fucifera bee orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, which mimics the appearance of a female bee to attract male bees for pollination. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a single, showy flower that is often colored in shades of yellow and brown. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands and rocky habitats. This orchid is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its specialized pollination strategy involving mimicry.
